Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2009 03:56PM curiousgeorgia wrote: Thanks, ladies for your further insight.  I also appreciate your words of wisdom on my worrying.  I am trying hard to overcome that, but I have issues with it.  Was all of your discharge spontaneous or only when provoked?  I saw that BFidelis' was spontaneous so I was wondering about the others.  BTW, I hope things get much better for all those who are having distressing times right now.  God bless and thank you again!
Posts.Title: Question for those who have had bloody nipple discharge curiousgeorgia barbe1958

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2009 03:36PM curiousgeorgia wrote: Now I am even more worried, part of why i debated even putting this question up :(

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2009 11:30AM curiousgeorgia wrote: Yes, I realize that overall, this is a BC website, but I really thought that this section was for those not diagnosed but worried.  I should have thought about those with BC who are on the other sections reading and replying to this section as well.  I guess they do this to reach out and comfort the ones who are on here.  Which is nice of them.  I am truly sorry about your diagnosis, Jennywren.  What did they remove if you didn't have a lump?  Did they just test the nipple discharge on a slide to diagnose you?  I realize that imaging techniques are not full proof.  I was told US was 94% accurate.  Wish there was a full proof method.  Anyway, if my doctor says that the milky discharge needs further evaluation, I will. For right now, she said to leave them alone and give them a chance to dry up.  She seems to think that it can take quite some months before your breast milk dries up after having a baby.
Posts.Title: Question for those who have had bloody nipple discharge curiousgeorgia barbe1958

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2009 09:23AM curiousgeorgia wrote: Barbe, I was NOT referring to you!  Sorry if you thought that.  I just was worried that Jennywren told me to go hard core on the doctors because it was likely to be cancer if you were young.  That did freak me out, I'm not going to lie.  This whole time, I thought it was normal to be producing milk after having a baby 2 months ago.  My doctor told me to leave them alone to dry them up, but I constantly check them because of my fears.  I am going to have to stop.  Like you guys say, I would know if God forbid, there were blood, etc.  Anyway, your comments did not scare me although I am sorry to hear of your diagnosis. God bless!
Posts.Title: Question for those who have had bloody nipple discharge curiousgeorgia barbe1958

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2009 03:31PM curiousgeorgia wrote: jennywren, so even though i just had a baby, you think i should pursue this and go hard core on the doctors?  you really think that if you're young it means cancer even if it's not bloody?  wow!  that is really scary.  how young are you if you don't mind my asking?  did you even have a lump? PS sorry to hear about your diagnosis!

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2009 03:29PM curiousgeorgia wrote: Gilro, was it bloody or just plain discharge?  did you just have a baby as well? I did talk to my doctor about it.  Again, she said it was normal to produce milk after you have a baby for some time and to stop squeezing them.  I am trying to trust that.  Gee, I really hope I should.  I am trying not to let some of these horror stories freak me out.  Nonetheless, thanks.
